name: Andrew Robinson Goes to Zany Zonkerville
description:
Andrew presents six original concepts/properties with conceptual drawings/sketches, character designs and storyboards. A rock band. A medieval fantasy. A western. And other cool stuff.

48 Pages, Hardcover, 12.5"x8.75"

name: Little Help? by Adam Hughes
description:
"More drawings, doodles & sketches." This year's Hughes sketchbook contains many striking pieces from Adam's current cover assignment Fairest, as well as incredible sketches of Indiana Jones, Princess Leia, Gwen Stacy, Batgirl, and many others. More adult content than previous sketchbooks.

Signed, 28 Pages, 8.5"x5.5", comic bound

name: What The Hall?  A Collection of Sketches by Natalie Hall
description:
A very winning sketchbook from this L.A. illustrator and visual development artist from Ringling College of Art and Design.
Animals and creatures derived from animals. pen & ink renderings, watercolor, or pencil sketches.

28 Pages, 8.5"x5.5", comic bound

name: A Heavy Dose of Crap by Tom Owens
description:
om Owens is head of story on How to Train Your Dragon 2, and was a story artist on How to Train Your Dragon, Monsters vs Aliens, Kung Fu Panda, and Madagascar.This is his only sketchbook.

96 Pages, 5.4"x8.5", paperback

name: The Art of Cory Loftis
description:
Cory is a Visual Development Artist at Walt Disney Feature Animation (Wreck-it Ralph). Prior to that, he created development artwork for Carbine Studios' game Wildstar.
This is his first solo book (after the group book Catra Sees All) and it is full of wonderful pieces created in his off hours,solely for his own amusement. Cory includes traditional and digital pieces. It's all beautiful stuff.

Signed, 72 Pages, 11"x8". paperback

name: The Gare Bear Companion by Garrett Hanna
description:
A great new book of colour illustrations by Garrett Hanna, ranging from pencil and watercolour to pure digital. 
Garrett was born and raised in Ontario and studied Animation at Sheridan College. Garrett lives in Southern California working in video games.

Signed, 44 Pages,  8"x6", paperback

name: Ty Carter Art: Musings and Wanderings
description:
Ty Carter is a Visual Development Artist at Blue Sky Animation Studios, children's book illustrator, and art instructor. 
This is his first collection, beautifully produced, in a very limited run, of wonderful digital paintings, each completed in 20 to 90 minutes.

Signed, 112 Pages, 5.5"x7", Paperback

name: Structura The Art of Sparth (Nicolas Bouvier)
description:
A beautiful collection of epic sci-fi landscapes and space opera works intermingled with sketches and futuristic design. The pages are filled with book covers, video-game concepts, and personal works, all of which draw you deep into the far off lands and strange worlds.

127 Pages, Paperback, 8.9"x8.8"x0.4",

name: From The Vault 5 by Mike Mignola
description:
Mignola's self-published 2012 annual, reprints covers, pin-ups and illustrations, many from obscure sources. Full-page pen and ink drawings exquisitely reproduced on heavy stock.
Signed and Numbered Edition of 1000, 28 pages, 10.25"x6.5", b+w, comic bound.

name: From The Vault 4 by Mike Mignola
description:
Mignola's self-published 2011 annual, reprints covers, pin-ups and illustrations, many from obscure sources. Full-page pen and ink drawings exquisitely reproduced on heavy stock. Eleven Hellboy pieces, BPRD, Thor, Iron Man, Batman, Catwoman, The Shadow, Sherlock Holmes, and other wonderful gothic images.

Signed and Numbered of 1200, 28 Pages, b+w, 10.25"x6.5", Comic Bound

name: From The Vault 3 by Mike Mignola
description:
Mike Mignola's self-published annual for 2010 reprints covers, pin-ups and illustrations, many from obscure sources.
Full-page pen and ink drawings exquisitely reproduced on heavy stock.
Eleven Hellboy pieces, BPRD, Baltimore, a Sock Monkey tribute, and other wonderful Gothic images.

Signed and Numbered edition of 1500, 28 Pages, 10.25"x6.5", b+w, comic bound

name: From The Vault 2 by Mike Mignola
description:
Mike Mignola's self-published chapbook for the 2009 San Diego Comic-Con is a collection of beautiful new, rare and/or unpublished full-page pen and ink drawings exquisitely reproduced on heavy stock.

Signed and numbered of 1500, 32 Pages, 10.25"x6.5", Comic Bound, b+w

name: A Year of Monsters by Mike Mignola
description:
The Year of Monster covers (the right hand pages) were done as variant covers for Lobster Johnson, B.P.R.D., Baltimore, and Hellboy comics and published one a month through 2012. All other drawings (the left hand pages) were done specifically for this book.

Signed, 28 Pages, 10"x6.5", b+w, comic bound, Limited edition of 1000

name: More Drawings by Mike Mignola
description:
A collection of all-new pen & ink drawings of Hellboy and associated characters, created in 2007 and 2008. 

One of 2000 signed and numbered limited edition.

Signed, 32 pages, 8.5"x5.5", b+w, comic bound

name: Ravishing Red by  J. Scott Campbell.
description:
This new addition to hard cover collections of the past years includes 52 full colour pages and a centerfold! A must have for anyone wanting to continue their J. Scott Campbell hard cover collection!

Signed, 52 Pages, Hardcover, 12.25"x8.75"

name: J. Scott Campbells Marvelous Art
description:
One of Scott's two 2011 SDCC sketchbooks. A large format, full colour, hardcover collection of J. Scott Campbell's renditions of Marvel characters. Marvel comic covers, pin-ups, and other art collected together in one volume.

Signed, 48 Pages, Hardcover, 12.5"x8.75"

name: White Hot by J. Scott Campbell
description:
One of Scott's two 2011 SDCC sketchbooks. A large format, full colour, hardcover collection of J. Scott Campbell works 1998-2011. Comic book covers, pin-ups, and commissioned art collected together in one volume. Superheroines, bathing beauties, fairy tales, Dejah Thoris, Planet of the Apes, Thundercats, and GI Joe.

Signed, 48 Pages, Hardcover, 12.5"x8.75"

name: Blue Beauties The Treasures Cargo by J. Scott Campbell
description:
A new printing of this large format, full color, hardcover collection of J. Scott Campbell works 1999-2010. Comic book covers, pin-ups, and commissioned art collected together in one volume. Bathing beauties, superheroines, and GI Joe.

Signed, 48 Pages, Hardcover, 12.5"x8.75"

name: Monster Green The Wicked Files by J. Scott Campbell
description:
A new printing of this large format, full colour, hardcover collection of a selection of J. Scott Campbell works from 1996-2009. A mix of brand new and older pieces including comic book covers, design work, commissions, Girlz N' Monsterz, Vampirella, Buffy, Frankenstein, and other artwork on the theme of HORROR!

Signed, 48 Pages, Hardcover, 12.5"x8.75"

name: Code Orange The Defector Archives by J. Scott Campbell
description:
The first of what has turned into a, must have collection for any J. Scott Campbell fan.

Signed, 48 Pages, Hardcover, 12.5"x8.75"

name: The Ruff Stuff Sketchbook vol. 1 by J. Scott Campbell
description:
Volume 1 of J. Scott Campbell's The Ruff Stuff sketchbooks! This horizontal sketchbook gives you the look and feel of real pencil sketches in a spiral bound, 48 page sketchbook! This sketchbook gives you an inside look into the process of conception to reality of the J. Scott Campbell artwork you know and love!

48 Pages, 8"x6", Spiralbound, Signed

name: The Ruff Stuff Sketchbook vol. 2 by J. Scott Campbell
description:
"Volume 2 of J. Scott Campbell's The Ruff Stuff sketchbooks! This vertical sketchbook gives you the look and feel of real pencil sketches in a spiral bound, 48 page sketchbook! This sketchbook gives you an inside look into the process of conception to reality of the J. Scott Campbell artwork you know and love!"

48 Pages, 8"x6", Spiralbound, Signed

name: The Art of Ryan Ottley Violence and Pinwheels
description:
Ryan's 2011 hardcover sketchbook includes: Invincible and Haunt covers, penciled and inked pages, character designs, fan sketches, commissions, and doodles!
72 Pages, Hardcover, Colour and black n white

name: Drawings by Jake Parker
description:
Hand picked drawings from the personal sketchbooks of artist Jake Parker.  Over 100 pages of robots, spacemen, vehicles, spaceships, characters and more.

Signed, 128 Pages, softcover, 7.5"x9.5"

name: The Antler Boy and Other Stories by Jake Parker
description:
A beautiful self published anthology of 10 graphic stories by the New York Times best selling illustrator and author of Missile Mouse.  If you like the Flight graphic story collections this is definitely for you.

Hardcover, 156 Pages, 10.2"x6.6"

name: SPACECAVE ONE by Jake Parker
description:
A collection of beautiful personal sketches full of robots, aliens, spaceships, dinosaurs and character work including Missile Mouse and Jack and the Beanstalk.  Each copy comes with its own original sketch card.
90 Pages Softcover.

name: Drawn Out The sketchbook of Brett Bean
description:
A great collection of Brett Beans pencil sketches, scribble, prelims and thumbnails, for characters creatures and landscapes.  If you want to see where it all begins this is the book for you.

100 Pages, Softcover, 8x8 inches

name: Character Art The Art of Brett Bean
description:
A collection of beautifully craft work split into sections by project and filled, primarily, with character, creature and alien designs with a sprinkling of environment work for good measure.

Signed, Hardcover, 8.25"x10.25", 76 Pages

name: 2D Bean: Welcome to My Brain The Art of Brett Bean 2
description:
Creatures, characters, environments and visual development art showing Brett Bean's amazing diversity in his 2013 art book.

48 Pages, Hardcover, 10x8 inches.

name: Slayboy by Adam Hughes
description:
Adam's tenth self-published sketchbook is made up almost entirely of his justifiably famous convention sketches rendered in copic marker: Tinkerbell, Catwoman, Batgirl, Poison Ivy, Black Cat, Mina Harker, Dejah Thoris, Vampirella, and other characters. Out of print.

signed, comic bound, 8.5x5.5, 28 pages, black n white

name: Thongs You Know By Heart by Adam Hughes
description:
Adam Hughes' sixth self-published sketchbook. Numerous drawings rendered in pencil, pen & ink, or Copic marker (stunning!). Adam also shows off some ink crosshatching techniques he hasn't used before. Ms. Marvel, Dejah Thoris, Mary Jane,Wonder Woman, Supergirl, Star Wars, etc. Beautifully offset printed in black & white. Out of print.

signed, comic bound, 8.5x5.5, 28 pages, black n white

name: Greatest Hits Volume 2 by Adam Hughes
description:
Adam's fifth annual sketchbook, full of voluptuous beauties and sci-fi icons. Catwoman, Batgirl, Star Wars, Power Girl, Scarlet Witch, Serenity, Mary Jane, etc. Zatanna sketch & finish. Out of print.

signed, comic bound, 8.5x5.5, 28 pages, black n white

name: Hissy Fit by Adam Hughes
description:
Adam's seventh self-published sketchbook. Red Sonja, Wonder Woman, Crystal, Storm, Luke and Leia, and a healthy helping of Catwoman! The Women of DC centerspread. Prelims, roughs, and finished cover art; commissions; sketchbook drawings; and other recent rare and unpublished material. Out-of-print.

signed, comic bound, 8.5x5.5, 28 pages, black n white

name: OH WOW by Adam Hughes
description:
Adam's ninth self-published sketchbook consists mostly of highly rendered works (more detailed than his convention sketches).  A beautiful, signed title by one of the best comic book and pinup artists around.

signed, comic bound, 8.5x5.5, 28 pages, black n white

name: Faust Impressions  by Adam Hughes
description:
Adam's 2011 sketchbook is full-color and made up almost entirely of his justifiably famous convention sketches rendered in copic marker: Supergirl, Wonder Woman, Red Sonja, Hawkgirl, Maggie (from Love & Rockets), Zatanna, Harley Quinn, Death, Catwoman, Black Cat, and other characters. Beautifully designed and produced.

signed, comic bound, 8.5x5.5, 28 pages, colour

name: Cheeks Unclenched by Sean Galloway.
description:
The superb 2009 edition annual sketchbook from Sean 'cheeks' Galloway.  Filled with character work of The Incredibles, Sailor Moon, Teen Titans, 3d model designs for Iron Man and sculptures for Bastion's 7 Kuta as well as much more.  

signed, 92 pages, hardcover

name: cheeks: still together by Sean Galloway
description:
cheeks: still together is rammed full of Sean 'cheeks' Galloway's super clean graphic style character art and comic book design work it also comes with a free tote bag patterned, with characters from Sean's own graphic novel Bastion's 7.
140 Pages Hardcover

name: Cheeks: Freshly Squeezed by Sean 'cheeks' Galloway
description:
Another fantastic volume in the great line of sketchbooks from a critically acclaimed comic book artist (Teen Titans Hellboy and personal project Bastions 7) and illustrator. Full of beautiful work and signed by the author.
100 Pages Hardcover

name: Table Taffy 1 by Sean "cheeks" Galloway and Ryan Benjamin
description:
A dual collection of Sean Galloway's Gumshoes 4 Hire and Ryan Benjamin's Pancratia.  Both comics are excellent in their own way however Sean's bubbly action adventure and Ryan's gritty post apocalyptic combat and piracy story both really show off their creators styles to the full.

100 pages Hardcover.

name: Table Taffy 2 by Ryan Benjamin and Sean "cheeks" Galloway
description:
A beautiful accompaniment to Table Taffy 1 this book contains many concept pieces background art and character designs for the artist's self initiated projects.

100 pages Hardcover

name: Octocheeks by Sean "cheeks" Galloway
description:
A collection of sketch work and character design by one of the most fluidly styled character designers in the business.  Having worked on Amazing Spiderman and the Hellboy animated series among many others, this book also covers work from his own self initiated Comic series Bastions 7 and Gumshoes 4 Hire.

50 pages Softcover 8"x10.5"

name: Sketchbook #16: Action Sketchbook by Ben Caldwell
description:
Another winner from Ben Caldwell! Full of great drawings, animation character design work, environment design, and sketches.

80 Pages, 8.5"x11", Softcover, signed.

name: Sketchbook #13 Les Femmes Imaginaire by Ben Caldwell
description:
All new art. This is a book of pin-up & cheesecake sketches. The artwork is in Ben's usual appealing cartoon style but is just a bit more revealing. Includes some nudity.

72 Pages, Softcover, 11"x8.5", B&W, Signed

name: Sketchbook #12 Summer & Fall 2007 by Ben Caldwell
description:
Series of sketches of: Wonder Woman; Supergirl; Batman family; Superboy and the Legion of Superheroes; Wolverine; plus other DC and Marvel characters. Included is some Harry Potter and super-hero art from earlier sketchbooks.

72 Pages, Softcover, 11"x8.5", B&W, Signed

name: Sketchbook #11 The Biggest Book of the Dare Detectives by Ben Caldwell
description:
Sketches and studies for The Dare Detectives. Characters, costumes, villains, props, vehicles, sets, scenes, page roughs. Lots of fun drawings.

72 Pages, Softcover, 11"x8.5" B&W Signed

name: Otomo Katsuhiro Artwork: KABA
description:
This hardcover art book is the collection of work from 1971 to 1989. In it are character designs, mechanical robots and detailed cityscape illustrations created for books, records, videos, comics, commercials, special sections dedicated to YOU (a TV series), The Watermelon Messiah and Farewell to Weapons.

178 Pages, Hardcover, 28.6 x 28.2 x 2.2cm, English/Japanese

name: Otomo Katsuhiro Artwork KABA 2
description:
A lovely big tome, full to the gunwales with amazing artwork and designs from the master behind the iconic anime Akira, Steamboy and Memories.

204 Pages, Hardcover in a box, 29cmx29cmx2.5cm, Japanese

name: 2007 Sketch Collection by Kim Jung-gi
description:
A very beefy tome filled to the gunwales with amazing sketches from a truly fantastic Korean artist.  The work covers character design through comic panels and nude studies, some of the sketches are painted most are linework in pencil or ink.

1000pages, Softcover, poster

name: 2011 Sketch Collection by Kim Jung-gi
description:
A massive book packed with amazing sketches from a great Korean artist. The work covers character design through comic panels and nude studies, some of the sketches are painted most are linework in graphite or ink.  Kim's style twists the world around his pencil, his ability to warp perspective is truly fantastic.

686 Pages, Hardback, random choice of 2 covers

name: Kim Jung-gi Sketches Collection 2013
description:
This book is packed with amazing sketches, mainly character art and street scenes.  Sniping school girls, anthropomorphic animals, mass battles and the inane made fantasy. Almost all the work was rendered in ink with no underdrawing, as can be seen in the book itself on a spread showing the man at work.

Hardcover with poster, 536 pages, 11"x8"x1.5"

name: Invoke: The art of Keron
description:
The first of many Trinquétte volumes from Comic creator, illustrator and industrial designer, Keron Grant.  Filled with sketches and design work for characters and studies and life drawing.

48 Pages, Hardcover, 12.5"x8.5"

name: Female of the Species: The Art of Viktor Kalvachev
description:
One of the most prolific conceptual artists, as well as one of the best comic book authors, shares his audaciously creative visions of the female of our species. 
From the artist: Female Species of all shapes, sizes, styles and mediums. This book is the beginning of a series I would like to publish that will collect only drawings of women using various styles and techniques. This is a celebration of all the women and artists that continue to inspire me every day and make me want to draw in styles I haven't even imagined I would be able to.

48 Pages, Hardcover, 12.5"x8.5"

name: Kustom Loliltaz by Dany Orizio
description:
The very first art book from fantasy Italian illustrator Dany Orizio. Illustrations from a world where men have become extinct, and the "time of redemption of the so-called weaker sex" is at hand.

48 Pages, Hardcover, 12.5"x8.5"

name: Birds and Pencils: DUCK by Florian Satzinger
description:
For those of you who don't know who Florian Satzinger is, he's an Austrian animator designer/illustrator and all around super friendly guy with a talent approximately the size of New Jersey. This is his first ever book published in America.

12.5"x8.75", Hardcover, 48 pages

name: Pieces of Wonderland by Bobby Chiu and Kei Acedera
description:
After designing characters for Tim Burton's "Alice in Wonderland" 2010 Bobby Chiu and Kei Acedera were asked to produce a series of paintings inspired by the beloved book. On March 4th 2010, the paintings were displayed and sold in a show at Galerie Arludik in Paris, France to celebrate the release of the film. This book is a collection of the paintings from the show as well as some never before seen work and sketches, a number of which resulted in the final paintings in the collection, and others that remained just ideas.

72 pages, Hardcover

name: Sugar Girls vol.1 The Art of Daniela Uhlig
description:
Daniela is a German artist working in a big company, where she creates designs, illustrations, and graphics. This book is a collection of her personal works. Lots of girls, and a fair number of octopi. And who doesn't like an octopus?

48 Pages, Hardcover, 8.5x12 inches

name: Monolith by William Wray
description:
A collection of Wray's paintings, mostly urban landscapes, with some figures and still lifes.

48 Pages, Hardcover, 8.5x12 inches

name: Denis Zilber Characters
description:
A great compilation of Denis' best illustration work and character design.

Hard cover, 8.5x12 inches, 48 pages

name: Sketchbook Oscar Martín
description:
Oscar Martin is a Barcelona-based comic book artist whose work is published all over Europe. His specialty is anthropomorphic animals, both cartoony (Tom & Jerry) and realistic (La Guilde).

Hardcover, 8.5x12 inches, 48 Pages

name: Eyes Wild Open by Mathieu Reynès
description:
The second volume of amazing sketches, drawings and design work from french comic book master Mathieu Reynès.

Hardcover, 8.5x12 inches, 48 Pages

name: Mail Order Monsters by Jason Felix
description:
Monsters and more gruesome monsters!! Tons of preliminaries and incredible ideas for some of the most scary creatures lurking under your bed.

48 Pages, Hardcover, 12.5"x8.5"

name: Trans Am Champions by Phil Noto
description:
A collection of the beautiful retro graphic stylised art work of a truly great artist.

48 Pages Hardcover

name: best of Arkady Roytman's Nude of the day year one
description:
Arkady's best watercolor drawings from his award winning series. 
Hard cover, 8.5x12 inches, 48 pages

name: Galerie 9E Art Exhibit by Frank Cho
description:
Exhibit catalogue from a May 2010 show at French Gallery, Galerie 9E Art, Paris.  This exhibit covered work from Conan, The Avengers, Thor, Shanna and Deja Thoris.
48 Pages

name: The Art of JP Kalonji
description:
A great compilation of his best illustration work and character design.
Hard cover, 8.5x12 inches, 48 pages,

name: Ramos art-n-out Sabotage by Humberto Ramos
description:
Humberto's latest hardcover sketchbook features convention sketches and commissions from 2011-2012. These pieces show his incredible draftsmanship and have a wonderful charm, even when representing the deadliest of super villains.

48 Pages, Hardcover, signed

name: Humberto Ramos Presents: My Marvels Vol. 1
description:
Humberto's latest is 56 pages of printed works, sketches, thumbnails, and never before seen material of Marvel characters.
Spider-Man, Black Cat, Iron Man, Deadpool, Thor, X-Men, and many more. Signed by the artist.

Signed, Hardcover, 56 Pages, 12.25"x8.75"

name: Art-n-Out Hip by Humberto Ramos
description:
Another great volume from a true comic book master. Filled with commission work from Comic conventions.

48 Pages, Hardcover

name: Sketchbox 4 by Francisco Herrera
description:
Another fantastic volume of Herrera's Sketchbox series, filled with his fabulous brand of comic book stylings.

48 Pages Hardcover

name: La Dynamo, N° 1 : Create Make and Move On! by Black Frog/La Grenouille Noire
description:
An amazingly eclectic group of work from one artist, graphic novels, posters, stickers, cards, sketches, video game and toy design, are all in some way encompassed in this book.  The book is basically an extremely well laid out catalogue for one man's artistic leanings.

Softcover, 29.5cmx20cm Landscape, French

name: Banana Shake by Matteo Scalera
description:
75 full-page black-and-white pin-ups of superhero and fantasy characters: Zatanna, Spider-Man, Daredevil, Red Sonja, Batman, Padme, Storm, Batgirl, the League of Extraordinary Gentlemen, Black Widow, Dr. Strange, Nova, and more!
Illustrated and designed entirely by Matteo Scalera, down to the banana scented scratch 'n' sniff on the cover!

Signed, Hardcover, 76 Pages, 12.75"x9"

name: Aphorismyth: A Collection of Art and Design by Raganar
description: Girls, beetles, and a fun sense of the grotesque inhabit this new book as well as an extensive look at the artist's epic advertising/promotional campaigns for Designer Con. Longtime fans of Ragnar should be thrilled with this, and newcomers to his work will be blown away by the visual showmanship.

name: The Art of Fiction presents Ragnar.
description:
This is artist Brandon Ragnar Johnson's first book with The Art of Fiction. It has more pencil drawings than any of his other books. There are a series of drawings for what could be new models for Big Daddy Roth's Weird-Ohs! There is also a lot of Ragnar's slick color design applied to superheroes, robots, girls, etc.

Signed, 48 Pages, Spiralbound, 8"x5"

name: Photo: A Collection of Art by Eric Canete
description:
A reassuringly weighty collection of Eric Canete's work with COPIC grayscale markers.  Bold, expressive drawings of original characters as well as Eric's unique imaginings of figures from comics, literature, and film, including Dejah Thoris, Elektra,The Goon and Frankie, Batgirl, Mr. Freeze, Totoro, Josie and the Pussycats, and more!

Signed, 96 Pages, Paperback, 8.5"x8.5"

name: Imagine Prime by Imaginary Friends Studios
description:
Just one and a half years after Imaginary Friends Studios burst onto the scene, it had enough commissioned work done for big brand-name international clients on major projects to fill a studio art book with chicks, zombies, mechs, chicks, aliens, dwarves, superheroes, a few more chicks, and much much more! The first edition sold out in a blink this is the second.
246 Pages Softcover

name: Henry Yan's Figure Drawing Techniques and Tips
description:
Full of fantastic charcoal and pencil figure drawings and sketches from a true master of the art of life drawing.

194 Pages, Softcover

name: Tekkonkinkreet Art Book White Side
description:
An excellent book full of the Background paintings from the critically acclaimed animated feature Tekkonkinkreet. The book is filled with painstakingly detailed artwork, from beginning to end.  If you love animated movies, environment design or just art in general this is the book for you.

296 Pages, Japanese, Hardcover

name: Tekkonkinkreet Art Book Black Side
description:
An excellent book rammed full of the Background concept sketches from the critically acclaimed animated feature Tekkonkinkreet.  If you are in to environmental design or anime or just great artwork this book is for you.

208 Pages, Japanese, Hardcover,

name: Trinquette Weeklies Vol. 1 by Various Artists
description: A great collection of beautiful pinup art by various artists, based on weekly reference images posted on facebook.

name: Quickie 2 David Palumbo
description:
Picking up where volume one left off, this all new collection features 96 more full color pages full of Palumbo's beautiful and aluring female figure studies and bound in a sturdy hardcover. Contained within are nearly 100 never before published paintings and drawings from the post card series and related works.

96 Pages, 10"x 10", Hardcover

name: The Art of Niko and the Sword of Light by Bobby Chiu and Kei Acedera
description:
The art book for the independently produced, fully animated iOS comic book.  Art by Bobby Chiu, Kei Acedera, Jim Bryson and Adam Jeffcoat.  This beautiful book, chronicles the journey to making “Niko and the Sword of Light”.  It includes exploratory drawings, paintings and concepts that are not seen in the comic book!

72 Pages, 10.5" x 8", softcover

name: Corpus Delicti by Serge Birault
description:
A collection of beautiful and surreal pinup portraits full of dark wit and whimsical caricature.

144 Pages, Hardcover, 12" x 9.7" x 0.7", French and English.

name: Cover Girls Illustrations by Guillem March
description:
This volume collects some of the best covers and other unpublished artwork from rising star Guillem March (Gotham City Sirens, Catwoman) featuring the sexiest women from his stunning work for Eros Comix Spain and Playboy Spain, never before seen in the USA.

80 Pages, Hardcover, 12.25" x 9.25", Mature Content.

name: A Gallery of Imagination: The Art of Ralph Mcquarrie
description:
This is the Ralph McQuarrie Art Exhibit Souvenir Program book from Star Wars Celebration V!
Some of the work will seem familiar, since it led to McQuarrie's iconic production paintings. While none of the original artwork from the Lucasfilm Archives was on display, in some cases the exhibit includes reproductions of those paintings to show the evolution from initial thumbnails to finished pieces.  Works from such iconic productions as the Original Star Wars Trilogy and Indiana Jones.

48 Pages, 11" x 8.5", Softcover, 1000 copy LE

name: Nix and Scratches Volume 2 by Alvin Lee
description:
Alvin lee is one of the few North American born artists still pushing the Anime/Manga aesthetic in comic books, games and media.  He has worked with several publishers to produce such titles as Star Wars, Deadpool, Transformers, Iron Man and Thundercats.  His art has also led to three Capcom games, Fighting Jam, SF2 Turbo HD Remix and Marvel vs Capcom 3.

Signed, 56 Pages, 8.5" x 5.25", Softcover

name: Chop Suey: The Art of Mindy Lee
description:
Concept artist Mindy Lee's tall, fashion model-style sketches include depictions of Harlequin, Poison Ivy, Batgirl, Catwoman, a suite of pieces inspired by Alice in Wonderland.

Signed, 40 pages, 11" x 7", paperback

name: Kaleidoscope: Art of Mindy lee
description:
The latest sketchbook from concept artist Mindy Lee.
Mindy has worked as a concept designer for Warner Bros, High Moon, and is currently at Carbine Studios. 

Signed, 60 Pages, 11" x 8.5", Paperback

name: Blue Collar/White Collar by Sterling Hundley
description:
Blue Collar/White Collar collects the art of award-winning illustrator and painter Sterling Hundley. This retrospective monograph is embellished with process while showcasing Hundley''s commercial work and fine-art career.

Signed, 184 Pages, Hardcover, 9.1" x 6.2 x 0.6"

name: Nuthin' But Mech - Sketches and Renderings
description:
Featuring the work of over 40 artists who contribute to the Nuthin' but Mech blogspot, a showcase of various styles of mecha design that the artists create while they are not working on blockbuster movies, TV shows and video games. Those interested in modeling, robots and mecha design will be in awe of the extensive range of artwork on display.

128 pages, 10.8"x8.4"x0.4", paperback

name: Sohen (Fragments) by Sho Murase
description:
Beautiful, silhouetted super heroines, harajuku girls, logo work and sketches fill this excellent works sampler.

Signed with a sketch, 40 Pages, Paperback, 10"x8",

name: Adi Granov Illustration
description:
A slick collection of illustrations of Wolverine, Black Widow, X-Men, the Avengers, some fantasy females, and lots of Iron Man. This sketchbook is mostly pencil shaded greyscale pieces, with a few full-colour.

28 Pages, 8.25"x5.75", Comic bound,

name: Bombshells 7: A Terry Dodson Sketch Book Collection
description:
Sexy women and great drawings fill this book from the creator of Muse. The 2-page center spread is Terry's beautiful full color piece for his Australian convention appearances in early 2013.

SIgned, 8.5"x5.5", 20 Pages, Comic bound,

name: Simone Bianchi Sketchbook San Diego 2013
description:
A great limited edition sketchbook filled with a collection of cover art, pinups and spreads by one of the great artists of the Marvel universe.

Signed, Comic bound, 9.5"x6.5", 40 Pages

name: Simone Bianchi San Diego 2012 Skecthbook
description:
A great limited edition sketchbook filled with a collection of cover art, pinups and spreads by one of the great artists of the Marvel universe.

Signed, Comic bound, 9.5"x6.5", 40 Pages

name: Simone Bianchi SKetchbook San Diego 2010
description:
A great limited edition sketchbook filled with a collection of cover art, pinups and spreads by one of the great artists of the Marvel universe.

Signed, Comic bound, 9.5"x6.5", 32 Pages

name: Walking Your Octopus by Brian Kesinger
description:
A beautifully produced and richly illustrated book that showcases the day-to-day adventures of independent girl-about-town Victoria Prismall and her pet land octopus Otto. Thirty panoramic, full-page illustrations humorously chronicle the duo's home and social activities that include (among other things) bathing, biking, dating, cooking, playing croquet, and pumpkin carving. Accompanying text explains the "do"s and "don't"s of living with a large land octopus. The book's art is extremely detailed, and each illustration by 16-year veteran Disney Feature Animation artist Brian Kesinger tells its own visual story. The Victorian era characters and period-influenced design elements combine to create a wonderful, collectible art-object for those who still value the classic elegance of ink-on-paper. The hardcover binding is plussed with two-layer embossing and spot varnish, and the interior is printed on extra heavy paper. An exquisite volume for lovers of books, art and pets.

Widescreen format Hardback, 7"x14", 64 Pages,

name: Dany Orizio: Monsters creator Sketchbook File 1
description:
A self published collection by the artist of Kustom Lolitaz. Dany Orizio is an Italian artist working in game design, RPG and card games, comics, and streetwear, as well as an art instructor. This is a sampling of his work, from sketches to pencils to finished digital painting.

Signed, 8.25"x5.5", 32 Pages, Comic bound

name: Gary Frank 2013
description:
Geoff Johns has said that Gary Frank's rendition of Superman is the best of his generation. There is plenty of Supes here in Frank's first sketchbook, along with Swamp Thing, Vampirella, Lara Croft, Batman, Powergirl, Poison Ivy, Wolverine, Hulk, Spider-Man, and more! 
Gary Frank is a British comic book artist, known for his incredibly powerful depictions of characters, from Superman to the Incredible Hulk and recently collaborated with Geoff Johns on Shazam!

Signed, 36 Pages, 11"x8.5", Comic bound

name: Sketches, Drawings and Musings by Brom
description:
Some truly beautiful sketches from the dark vault of Brom's mind.  These may be preliminaries for paintings or character designs for fantasy games.

Signed, 20 Pages, 8.5"x5.5", Comic bound,

name: The Usagi Yojimbo Sketchbook #10 by Stan Sakai
description:
This sketchbook features excellent b+w page inks as well as lines for cover art and character pinups from Stan Sakai the creator of Usagi Yojimbo.

Signed, 24 Pages, 8.5"x5.5", Comic bound

name: Pretty Little Things: The Doodle Book of Whitney Pollett
description:
Whitney is a Los Angeles-based artist and toy designer who has worked at Disney Consumer Products, Mattel, and other. Her work has great flow and a lot of charm. She draws girls that other girls will like.

Signed with a drawing, 34 Pages, 8.5"x5.5", Comic bound

name: Nonsense by Brianne Drouhard
description:
A full colour collection of Brianne's wonderful sketchcard art and drawings 2012-2013. Amethyst, Teen Titans, superheroes and heroines, ponies, unicorns, dragons, cats, Space Unicorn, and more.

If you liked Billy the Unicorn you'll love this.

Signed with a sketch, 32 pages, 8.5"x8.5", Comic bound

name: Mike Choi Lookbook 2013-2014
description:
Tonal illustrations and drawings, mostly rendered in graphite, graphite and marker, graphite and digital. X-Men and X-women, Batman and company, Thundercats, and other comic and fantasy characters.
Mike is best known for his artwork on Marvel titles such as X-Force, X-23, Uncanny X-Men, Astonishing Thor, and Fantastic Four. He has also drawn books for DC Comics (Green Lantern, Demon Knights) and Top Cow Productions (Witchblade, Tomb Raider) and has had lengthy cover runs on Fantastic Four for Marvel, and Demon Knights and Captain Atom for DC Comics.

Signed, 64 Pages, Paperback, 11"x7"

name: Half Past The Collected Art of Mike Yamada and Victoria Ying
description:
Twenty fully-rendered double-page "widescreen" illustrations by Mike and Victoria. Beautiful, outstanding pieces. 

Limited edition of 500, 42 Pages, Paperback, 6.5"x8.5"

name: Sketches Doodles and Ideas: A Brett Bean Sketchbook 2013
description:
The newest sketchbook from Brett Bean.  An amazing range of character and creature design. 

Signed with a sketch, 76 Pages, Paperback, 10"x6.5", B/W with 9 color pages,

name: Bill Sin-KEV-itch Sketchbook 2013 by Bill Sienkiewicz
description:
Four colour pieces and 31 full-page black & white pieces: The Shadow, Tarzan, Vampires,  Jimmy Hendrix, Conan, the Joker and more!

Signed, 36 Pages, Comic bound, 11"x8.5"

name: Bill Sin-KEV-itch Sketchbook 2012 by Bill Sienkiewicz
description:
A couple of excellent colour pieces with the rest of the book, full page b+w renderings of figures from comics, fantasy, movies, and life, as well as four pages of concept art from "Electro*Love," a comic by Dave Stewart & Bill Sienkiewicz. 

Signed, 36 Pages, Comic bound, 11"x8.5"

name: Alex Ross 2013 SDCC Sketchbook
description:
A collection of pencil studies, cover roughs, character designs, and sketches from the world renowned superhero painter.

Signed, Paperback, 11"x8.5", 36 Pages, predominantly b+w

name: Alex Ross 2012 SDCC Sketchbook
description:
A collection of pencil studies, cover roughs, character designs, and sketches from the famed superhero painter.

Signed, 36 Pages, Comic bound, 11"x8.5"

name: Savage Beauty: Book 1 by Frank Cho
description:
Frank's latest sketchbook is devoted entirely to his trademark jungle girl: beautiful, muscular, a killer of crocodiles and dinosaurs, prey to pinching crabs and tiny loincloth-grabbing dinos. A great collection of pencils.

Signed, 64 Pages, Paperback, 11"x8.5"

name: Structura 2 the Art of Sparth
description:
A beautiful collection of epic sci-fi landscapes and space opera works intermingled with sketches and futuristic design.
This stunning book includes never-before-seen video game concepts from Assassins Creed and Halo, book cover art, as well as fantasy and science fiction pieces. The last chapter gives step-by-step tutorials on different Photoshop techniques. This is an unmissable volume for fans of Sparth's work and aspiring designers.

name: DRIVE by Scott Robertson, Daniel Gardner and Annis Naeem
description: Robertson s latest vehicle designs intended for the video game space, featuring skillfully drawn sketches and renderings. Divided into 4 chapters, each with a different aesthetic: aerospace, military, pro sports and salvage, the book is bursting with black-and-white and full-colour images of sports cars, big rigs and off-road vehicles.

name: Punch Drunk Moustache: Visual Development for Animation and Beyond.
description:
Artists, Amy Beth Christenson, Max Lim, Jeff Sengalli,  John-Paul Balmet, Will Nichols, Nate Watson, Sean Pando and Chris Voy
have created a great insight into producing a series of visual development pieces for use in animated features.
Punch Drunk Moustache is the off-the-clock work of eight animation industry artists with the insatiable need to tell stories. Each artist showcases new ideas infused with unique personal style. Get ready for stunning visual development and never before seen concepts. Giants, androids, strange beasts, brave animals, magic, mystery, and everyday folks collide in these vividly imagined tales.

128 Pages, Softcover, 11"x9"

name: Battle Milk 2 by Kilian Plunkett, Thang Le, Wayne Lo and Jackson Sze
description:
BATTLE MiLK 2 is the latest collection from several San Francisco-based animation professionals featuring personal works and original concept designs.  Everything from traditional pen-and-ink to miniature photography to cutting edge digital painting can be found as new worlds and ideas are explored. Each artist provides a step by step guide to their creative process, from inspiration to techniques for realizing their ideas. Fans of all styles of imaginative design and illustration will find plenty to enjoy in this eclectic volume.
125 Pages Softcover 11"x9"

name: Battle Milk 3
description:
In the third larger instalment of Battlemilk there are now nine artists, namely Christian Alzmann, Justin Ridge, Matt Gaser, Pat Presley, David Le Merrer, Thang Le, Kilian Plunkett, Le Tang and Jackson Sze. 
The book is full of self initiated design work for individual projects.  Thang Le reveals ancient temples hidden in mountains using his landscape paintings. Christian Alzmann presents a dark tale about a florist in search for a rare flower. Le Tang creates concepts with circus as a theme. Other ideas include a boy who flew to the moon, a sci-fi tale of another Earth, a planet trillions or years old and inhabited by robots, a world of mythical creatures, weird photos from "Little Shutter Boy" and a dreamscape world.

160 pages, Softcover, 11"x9"

name: Aspect Ration by Robh Ruppel
description:
A beautiful book full of sci-fi environments, digital plein-aire paintings and sketches, from a great artist.

132 pages, Softcover, 9"x6"x3/8"

name: Ink Works Sketch Book 2011 by Peter Nguyen
description:
A great ink sketch book from a superb animation and comic book artist, full of character design and pinup concepts from Marvel and DC.

46 Pages, Softcover,

name: Chocolate a Collection of Art by Eric Canete
description:
Eric Canete is an illustrator and designer working in the animation and comic book industries.  This book contains his fresh, unique take on an assortment of superheroes as well as lots of original non-character illustrations.
Some of his past projects include Aeon Flux, Men In Black, Justice League Unlimited, Legion of Superheroes, Ben 10: Alien Force and (in comic books) Iron Man: Enter The Mandarin, The End League.
58 Pages Softcover 9"x6" Signed by the artist.

name: Croissant: A Collection of Art by Stephane Roux
description:
This fifth sketchbook is made up almost entirely of con sketches commissioned by fans: Zatanna, Mary Jane, Batgirl, Black Cat, Dejah Thoris, Captain America, Harley Quinn, Poison Ivy, Wonder Woman, Big Barda, Vampirella, Rocketeer, Lois Lane, Star Wars, and others. Most are ink pieces finished with greytone or color markers.

Paperback

name: Dédicace by Eric Canete
description:
This sketchbook features the personalized sketches created by Eric Canete for fans who pre-ordered or attended the Encore Book signing.
42 full page black & white illustrations, each reproduced at the same size as the original (1:1). It features a mix of characters from comics, games, Mythology, Harry Potter, and even a very cool Calvin and Hobbes.

name: Sketchbook by Roman Muradov
description:
A lovely little sketchbook by a young illustrator/cartoonist with a very appealing style collecting sketches of people done on the fly, most of the drawings in this sketchbook were done in San Francisco (mainly on bus 21) with a Pentel brush pen.
16 Pages Comicbound 8"x5.25"

name: Doodle Drops A Collection of Sketches and Art by Arree Chung
description:
A collection of sketches drawings and children's book illustrations in a great little book.
32 Pages, Comicbound 5"x7"

name: Japon - Nueva York by Axel Ortiz (Axel#13)
description:
A great collection of space aliens, monsters, astronauts, finished and in process, all created during trips between New York, Los Angeles, and Japan.

5"x7.25", comic bound, 56 pages, signed

name: Plomo Special Edition by Andrea Fernandez and Trevor Spencer
description:
Charming and humorous character designs and drawings.  After their first printing of 100 copies sold out at CTNX, the duo created this expanded special edition featuring 16 extra colour pages, foil stamping, and a cover sleeve (obi band). Limited to 450 copies.

signed, 7"x5.5", 118 pages, softcover, black n white + colour.

name: Travis Charest Sketchbook
description:
The new sketchbook from Travis, the creator of Spacegirl and artist of Weapons of the Metabaron! Plenty of Captain America and Spacegirl, plus Wolverine, Iron Man, Conan, often showing both his finished pencil version and the final ink version.  Plus three pages of unpublished comic book pages!

Signed, 32 Pages, 8.5"x5.5", Comic bound

name: Sketchbook 4 by Chris Sanders
description:
This is a signed copy of the fourth in a fantastic series of sketchbooks.  Chris' out-of-print 2010 sketchbook has girls & dragons, lions, tigers, imaginary creatures, girls on broomsticks, animals, jet pack girls, and more. Rough pencils, finished ink drawings, and finished colour pieces including a foldout.

Signed, 48 pages, 8.5"x5.5", Paperback

name: Chris Sanders Sketchbook 5
description: Chris' 2011 sketchbook has lots of girls, as well as imaginary creatures, mermaids, and animals. Lots of rough pencils, plus finished ink drawings, and eight watercolors and finished color pieces.

name: Thoughts, Scribbles + Madness Volume 3 by Creaturebox
description:
Following monstrously in the footsteps of the sold out Volume 1, Volume 2, and Palindrone Robot Supply, CreatureBox has returned with a new year of quirky robots, maniacal monsters, and valiant spacemen. Thoughts, Scribbles, + Madness: Volume 3 collects a broad range of re-envisioned concepts, illustrations, and many never before seen creations for 2010! 
signed, 5.5"x8.5", comic bound, 28 pages, 40 minute DVD

name: Mildly Afflicted/Topsy Turvy by Steph Laberis/Brianne Drouhard
description: A joint sketchbook by Steph Laberis and Brianne Drouhard. Steph is a Berkeley artist (out of Rhode Island School of Design) working as a character designer, toy designer and video game concept artist. Brianne is a TV animation character designer and children's book illustrator (Billie the Unicorn). This collection of color illustrations & drawings is full of fun, appealing work in a variety of styles and media.

name: Derek Monster Annual 2009 by Derek Thompson
description:
An excellent collection of creatures in a superb graphic style (mostly b+w some colour), in fact a monster for every day of the year.

128 Pages, Small Paperback, Signed

name: Scribble-Tor by Tori 'Cat' Davis
description:
Tori "Cat" Davis is a Visual Development and Environmental Designer  This collection of artwork is about equally divided between environments, layouts, and animals, with a smattering of figure drawings, character designs, and cartoons.
52 Pages Comic Bound 9.5"x6.5"
signed and numbered by the artist

name: Sketchbook 2009.02 by Walt Simonson
description:
The second volume in a continuing series of sketchbooks from the archives of the legendary Walt Simonson. Each image is accompanied by Simonson's captions. This volume has 28 interior pages and special cover art created just for this edition.
32 Pages, Comic Bound, 8.5"x5.5" signed by the artist

name: Familiar Vices 2 a Sketchbook by Robh Ruppel
description:
Robh is a wonderful painter-illustrator who also creates lovely little cheesecake pieces. Like all the best pin-up artists, the subject matter appears completely natural and second nature. This second sketchbook is composed entirely of female figures, minimally clothed, in a variety of poses. 

24 Pages, 8.5"x5.5", Comic Bound, Signed Limited Edition of 500.

name: Autumn in Berlin Sketchbook by Uwe Heidshötter
description:
A collection of sketches of the people on the streets of Berlin in late 2009, done in the inimitable style of this superb animation director and designer.
60 Pages, Softcover, Signed.

name: Jack Loves You by Shawn "Billy" Sagulo
description:
Shawn is an illustrator and designer in the game industry. This is a collection of pencil drawings of pretty girls.

28 Pages, Comic Bound, signed with a picture

name: Rough Beasts 4 by Bill Halliar
description:
A great little book collecting sketches, characters, comic strips and panels as well as some wonderful environmental design work from a superb illustrator and comic book artist.

52 Pages, Comic Bound, Signed

name: Sketches 2010 by Aaron Lopresti
description:
A self promotional book from a fantastic comic book artist. 1 of 500.

24 Pages, Comic Bound, Signed.

name: Urban Barbarian by Dan Panosian
description:
Dan is a comic book artist, and commercial illustrator as well as a founding member of The Original Drink & Draw Social Club,
This is an eclectic collection with a lot of great drawings and sketches.
Included are monsters, superheroes, barbarians, and some excellent girls, many of which started life at club 'meetings'.
54 Pages Comic Bound 8.5"x5.5"

name: The Business of Monkeys by Brian Herrick
description:
The Business of Monkeys is a collection of drawings, doodles, sketches, comics and from the pages of Brian Herrick’s sketch book.

24 Pages, Comicbound, 8"x5.25"

name: You Asked For It by Jeffrey Moy
description:
A (signed and numbered limited edition of 500) collection of sketches by a fantastic comic book artist.

32 Pages, Comic Bound, Signed and Numbered

name: Little Big Things by Pascal Campion
description:
A truly lovely collection of illustrations and sketches in a beautifully simple yet elegant style.

104 Pages, Softcover, 10"x8" Landscape

name: Birds by Gustavo Duarte
description:
A beautifully illustrated comic horror story told entirely without words. Two birds go to their office one morning only to discover a dead body - and the Grim Reaper knocking at their door! The bodies pile up as the pair try to evade death. Full of black humor, charm, appeal and wonderful design. Gustavo is a Brazilian newspaper cartoonist. This is only his third comic story but it is a gem.

40 Pages, Comic Bound

name: Alchemy Sketchbook by Michael Golden
description:
Michael's latest collection features ink drawings of a variety of characters including Princess Leia, Herobear, the Thing, Venom, the Death Dealer, Alien, Wonder Woman, Kazar, Kiss, and Lone Wolf and Cub!

36 Pages, Softcover, 11"x8.5", signed

name: 2ply Parachutes 2010 by Bart Kaufman
description:
A signed collection of sketches taken from the blog of the same name.

24 Pages, Comic Bound, Signed

name: Loose Cannon on a Gravy Train The Sketchbook of Jeff Merghart
description:
This collection of sketches from Jeff Merghart has a little bit for everyone. Merghart draws pirates, monsters, and creatures from different eras and fantasy worlds. This book has finished pieces and shows his process. Merghart has worked as an animator for Disney, Bluth Studios and Klasky Csupo. He currently works at Sony Online Entertainment. You may be familiar with his work from the game The Mark of Kri, which he worked on as lead designer. Much of the game's preliminary and concept work can be seen in this wonderful new sketchbook.

56 Pages, 10"x8", Comic Bound, Signed

name: LOL, Coffee Break by The Staff of Lolapps
description:
A superb array of character sketches and designs together with some beautiful environmental work, the styles of the multitude of artists from Lolapps gel wonderfully to make an excellent art book.

Artists: Glenn Kim, Mike Bear, Nate Berna, Joshua De Leon, Brandon Pike, Elie Dagher, Jerry Tzeng and Roman Muradov.

42 Pages, Paperback.

name: Sketchbook by Pres Romanillos
description:
Pres Romanillos was a highly regarded animator at Disney and Dreamworks. He animated Pocahontas and Shan-Yu (the villain in Mulan) and Little Creek (Spirit: Stallion of the Cimarron).  This sketchbook was conceived by his widow Jeannine Romanillos and reproduces artwork from Pres' sketchpads and sketchbooks: life drawings, horse and animal studies, Disney character drawings, travel sketches, and a sampling of his personal cartoons and drawings.
32 Pages Comic Bound

name: Illustration 2013 an Anthology.
description:
A chunky anthology of critically acclaimed artwork produced by 150 great  modern Japanese artists.  The work is taken from editorials, pinups, book covers, fan art and advertising.  The vast majority of the work in this book is full of the slightly off kilter but amazing style of modern Japanese illustration, with the occasional dollop of western influence.

320 pages, Softcover, 10.1"x7.6"x1.3", Japanese

name: Anime Digital Background Method
description:
A great little Japanese how to book for creating Anime background artwork with excellent atmospheric skies.

144 Pages, 9.1"x7.2"x0.4", Softcover, Japanese,

name: Super Pose Book by Koji Shimamoto
description:
A great resource for the artist, multiple angles of each pose (standing, sitting and reclining) cleanly shot clear images for easy use.

144 Pages, 10.1"x7.5"x0.5", Softcover, Japanese,

name: Drawing Lab Series Dynamic Nude Poses by Koshigoe Tsuneo
description:
An all colour nude reference, each pose is shot twice from different angles and are generally short study poses. The majority of the book is full of female models however there is a section of male poses as well.

160 Pages, Softcover, Japanese, 10.3"x7.3"x0.5"

name: DMC Devil May Cry Visual Art
description:
This is about as comprehensive a video game art book you could wish for, it covers a great many character/creature designs and environments, level design and object work.  As well as work for the game itself there is also a section of pinup and promotional work from the game's marketing campaign.

192 pages, Japanese, Softcover, 11.6"x8.4"x0.7"

name: Gales and Girls by Takashi Fujisawa
description:
The creator of Egg-plane and Self-defense officer Soreyuke has filled this book with his anime style military girls, girls in mech suits, carrying huge guns and generally enjoying themselves.

130 Pages, Japanese, Softcover, 11.6"x8.3"x0.4"

name: Sangokushi Taisen Trading Card Game Visual Guide Artbook
description:
Hundreds of pieces of sword and sorcery card game art, from multiple artists in many styles, fill the pages. Almost entirely a straightforward gallery, this book would be for anyone who loves asian fantasy art.

160 Pages, Japanese, 11.6"x8.3"x0.5"

name: Birth of the Shin Megami Tensei IV Official Art book.
description:
Te complete setting of the game, including character and creature design, backgrounds and environments as well as some of the promotional pinups.

208 Pages, Softcover, 11.6"x8.4"0.9", Japanese

name: Quantum Flowers Nagimiso Vocaloid Artworks
description:
The culmination of 7 years work by the illustrator Miso Mr. Nagi, this book contains character designs, toys sequentials and truly amazing pinup and marketing artworks.

125 pages, softcover,11.6"x8.3"x0.5", Japanese

name: Katsuya Terada 10 Ten - 10 Year Retrospective
description:
The catalog of the 10 Exhibition of Katsuya Terada's work in the Kyoto Manga Museum, also contains work not featured in the exhibition.  Although not showing any one piece in great detail this book covers a vast array of subjects including robots, monsters, cars, girls, vampires, heroes, cartoons, illustration and character design.

326 Pages, Softcover, 8.4"x 6"x1.1", Japanese

name: Lord of Vermilion Re:2 ver R2.2 Illustrations Scarlet.
description:
A wide range of fantasy art from multiple artists for the card and video game Lord of Vermilion Re:2 as well as pinups, marketing artwork and character designs.

175 pages, softcover, 11.6"x8.4"x0.6", Japanese

name: Beautiful Noise by Shunya Yamashita
description:
More beautiful illustrations from the popular character and pinup artist Shunya Yamashita covering some of his work from Tekken Tag Tournament 2, Border Break, Disgaea 4, Lord of Vermilion and more.

112 pages, softcover, 11.6"x8.3", japanese

name: Photos in Japan: Landscape Architecture and Natural Beauty Coloured By History
description:
A collection of photographs covering the beauty and vivid nature of Japan's islands.  The amazing wealth of difference that can be encountered with one country is amply explored within this book, making it a great reference for any artist or lover of travel.

128 pages, softcover, 10.2"x7.2", Japanese

name: Tiger + Bunny Original Paintings and Rough Assembly by Masakazu Katsura
description:
Masakazu Katsura's original pencil character designs, illustrations and character sheets as well as a full colour one shot comic.

16 pages, softcover, 11.6"x8.4", Japanese

name: GENGA Otomo Katsuhiro Original Pictures
description: This book is a catalogue for Otomo's initial exhibition (held in Tokyo, April 9-May 30, 2012) of his original drawings collected from his debut, to the present. The book contains all the works featured in the exhibition, that is full-size illustrations, as well as preliminary sketches as well as production drawings, including his domestic advertising works that is hardly seen overseas.

name: Zenbu The Complete Works by Katsuya Terada
description:
An amazing collection of the Rakugaki and illustration sketches from a great anime/manga artist.  Katsuya Terada has produced artwork for several video games comic books and animated movies.

298 Pages, Softcover, Slipcase, Japanese, Explicit Content

name: Rakuga King by Terada Katsuya
description:
This 1000-page sketchbook contains a selection of sketches drawn over a period of 20 years prior to 2001. These are mainly character sketches created with pencil and ink.

1000 pages, Softcover, Japanese, Adult Content

name: Tang Yuehui CG Illustrations Set (唐月辉CG插画作品集)
description: A portfolio book concentrating mostly on pinups and mythology in a distinctly Chinese style.

name: Perfect World: The Original Painting Set of the Classic Game (完美时空:经典游戏原画设定
description:
A very rich collection of art from an amazing MMORPG game, the book covers character art, environment design, object creation and creature realisation, for both the game and promotional material.  All the works within are based n ancient chinese myth mixed with the world view of magic.

231 Pages, Softcover, Chinese

name: Water: Vagabond Illustration Collection by Inoue Takehiko
description:
This art book by Inoue Takehiko is based on the manga Vagabond. If you like the manga and the water colour section that starts each comic, this book is definitely for you. It contains many beautiful watercolour full page illustrations, some of which come from panels and covers from the comic book.

164 Pages, Softcover,

name: Shining Hearts Collection of Visual Materials
description:
Original Japanese version an amazing video game art book for the psp game Shining Hearts.  The bulk is made up of characters created by Japanese pinup artist and character designer Tony Taka.  There are full page character illustrations as well as concept sketches, environment designs and item artwork.

192 pages, softcover, Japanese

name: Pepper Project by Imaginary friends Studios
description:
A collection of art from the originator (Artgerm) of the character Pepper as well as a collection of fanart chosen from professional and amateur artists alike by the Imaginary Friends Studios team.
220 Pages Softcover in Slipcase

name: Imaginary Redux by Imaginary Friends Studios
description:
If you want to pick up some tips and get a glimpse of what goes on "behind-the-scenes" at Imaginary Friends Studios, then this is the art book for you.

48 Pages Softcover.

name: Charm: Vofan's Otona Fantasy Artworks
description:
A great collection of superb manga pinups and one shots, with details and sketches.

184 Pages, Softcover, Japanese

name: Complete official visual illustration collection TV anime Persona 4
description: A great collection of illustrations and character pinups from the TV anime Persona 4 from the mind of Shigenori Soejima.

name: Takehito Harada Art Works I by Takehito Harada
description:
The first personal art book of Takehito Harada the designer of the 'Disgaea' series.  The art in this book covers pinups, game characters, advertising art and runs through the process of creating works.

207 Pages, Softcover, Japanese.

name: Birth Kozue Amano Illustration Works 4
description:
Kozue Amano (天野 こずえ), the artist who created the “Aria” manga and also draws the currently running “Amanchu!” series released a new artbook. Titled “Birth 天野こずえ Illustration Works 4”, it is her fourth art collection after the previous books “Alpha”, “Stella” and “Cielo”  This book contains new beautifully coloured illustrations from the world of Aria.

95 pages, Hardback (plastic slip), Japanese

name: Catherine Visual & Scenario Collection Venus Mode
description:
A collection of character artwork, pinups and storyboards from the video game Catherine.  An excellent view into the mind of the designer, Shigenori Soejima and concept artists for this superbly weird puzzler

160 Pages, Softcover, Japanese.

name: Shooting Star Carnaval Art Book : Cherry Blossom Quartet by Yasuda Suzuhito
description:
This book is full of cover art, illustrations and pinups from an array of anime mostly Yozakura Quartet and Kamisama Kazoku with the likes of Code Geass, Love Plus and Shin Megami Tensei making up the rest.

128 pages, Softcover,  Japanese

name: Makoto Shinkai Artworks: Children Who Chase Lost Voices from Deep Below
description:
A book more filled with beautiful anime background paintings and some great character design you would be hard pushed to find.  Not to be confused with The Sky of the Longing for Memories book, although similar in their excellence and quality of art, this book edges far more in to the realm of classical fantasy rather than sci fi.

192 pages, Softcover, Japanese

name: KYMG:2 by Yusuke Kozaki
description:
This is a paperback collecting Yusuke Kozaki's manga work, character designs and sketches from 2008 to 2012. Even in the first book, his art is already very refined. You get to see even more pieces of beautiful art here, all printed quite large.

Kozaki is still working on the manga series Kyoko Karasuma The Detective of Asakusa Police Department (烏丸響子の事件簿). The first few pages start with the manga covers and splash pages.



Softcover, Japanese, 134 pages

name: KYMG Yusuke Kozaki Illustrations
description:
A superb art book full of character design work and pinups from a fantastic Japanese illustrator whose work includes Kyoko Karasuma the series Speed Grapher and Intrigue in the Bakumatsu - Irohanihoheto.

Softcover, Japanese, 134 pages

name: Legend of Monsters Official Art Book.
description:
An excellent collection of art from the world of card illustration used for the game Legend of Monsters.

104 Pages, 12"x8.3"x0.5", Hardcover, Japanese,

name: The Art of Captain America - The First Avenger
description:
One of the better art of a movie books out there. This book, as expected of a marvel production, contains a huge amount of design work, and all of it is of exceptional quality.

224 Pages, Hardcover

name: THOR: The Art of Thor The Movie
description:
A collection of the excellent concept art used in the making of a Marvel superhero movie, as well as photographs of many of the props, sets and costumes.

224 Pages, Hardcover

name: Avengers: The Art of Marvel's The Avengers.
description: THE ART OF THE AVENGERS features stunning concept art; full-color photographs from the set, as well as the finished film; excerpts from the script; and exclusive interviews with the cast and crew.  From costume and production design to visual effects and creature creation, THE ART OF THE AVENGERS is a lavish showcase of all the artistry and creativity that brings the Marvel Cinematic Universe to life onscreen.

name: The Art of Kung Fu Panda 2
description: The Art of Kung Fu Panda 2 takes readers behind-the-scenes of the animated martial arts mega-sequel. Po, the recently anointed Dragon Warrior, is living his dream as the champion of the Valley of Peace an evil warlord threatens to destroy all of China by creating an unstoppable weapon that promises to supplant kung fu. Included in this tome of production artwork are character designs and epic environments.

name: The Ballad of Rango: The Art & Making of an Outlaw Film
description:
An amazing book full of wonderfully detailed character and concept design work.  The town and every character and landscape shows the effects of the harsh desert environment, from the twisted forms to the dust covering every surface and the surreal episodes of dehydration.

156 Pages, Hardcover, 28.9 x 26.1 x 2.3 cm

name: Art of Brave
description:
Brave is Pixar's first fairy tale, a lush, animated adventure through the forests, heaths, and highlands of medieval Scotland. Featuring behind-the-scenes interviews with the film's many artists, The Art of Brave also showcases the gorgeous concept art that went into the creation of the movie, including colour scripts, storyboards, character studies, environment art, sculpts, and more.

160 Pages, Hardcover, 27.9 x 22.9 x 2 cm

name: The Art of District 9
description: An amazing art of book covering the beautifully crafted Sci-Fi feature debut of Neill Blomkamp and the WETA FX team.

name: The Art of Gears of War 3
description:
The Art of Gears of War 3 takes you behind the scenes of one of Epic Games’ biggest releases. It features character, environment, monster, weapons, and vehicle concept art and production art in comprehensive galleries.  The book shows some of the unseen art that makes Gears of War 3 one of history’s most anticipated games.

317 Pages, Paperback

name: The Art of the Mass Effect Universe
description:
A vast collection of art from the entire series of Mass Effect games including character design, creatures and environments.  The shear depth of work shown in the pages of this book could make you believe this vision of the universe was real and had already been visited by the artists at Bioware.

184 Pages, Hardcover

name: Massive Black Volume 2: Slipcase Edition edited by Kemp Remillard
description:
Every ounce of their art has that distinct Massive Black flavour of awesomeness, which translates beautifully in the pages of Ballistic Publishing’s Massive Black volume 2 - a visual tour de force that chronicles many of their artistic achievements from 2008-2012.
 
208 pages, softcover in a slipcase

name: Hardware: The Definitive SF Works of Chris Foss
description:
Foss's groundbreaking and distinctive science fiction art revolutionized paperback covers in the 1970s and 80s. Dramatically raising the bar for realism and invention, his trademark battle-weary spacecraft, dramatic alien landscapes and crumbling brutalist architecture irrevocably changed the aesthetic of science fiction art and cinema. This volume brings together many rare and classic images that have never been seen or reprinted before. The first comprehensive retrospective of Chris Foss sci-fi career.

240 Pages, Hardcover, 31 x 24 x 2.9cm, English

name: Altered Scapes Animation Art Vol 1 by Valerio Ventura
description:
Valerio Ventura has been an artist in the entertainment industry for over 25 years, as an animation production designer, art director (Class of 3000), visual development artist (Emperor's New Groove, Mulan, Hercules, Rescuers Down Under), and a director of commercials. This is his showcase of his personal work (often deriving from his industry work) with a focus on Dark Fantasy and Fairy Tale design.

92 pages, Hardcover, Signed, English/Italian/German

name: ABAKAN 2288 Kallamity's World of Mecha Design Part One
description:
A true master class in kit bashing Mecha and their pilots.  A beautiful collection of photographs and design work showing the steps that go into  making these amazing high quality scif-fi models.

176 Pages, Softcover

name: Velocity by Stephan Martiniere
description:
Velocity is a stunning new visionary collection from the imagination of acclaimed illustrator Stephan Martiniere. The fantasy and SF artist has worked for numerous film studios, including Disney and Warner Bros., as well as video game companies. This book showcases his sci-fi book cover paintings, commercial and film art, video game designs, and other never before-seen artwork. Unmissable.

64 pages, Hardcover, slight transport damage to top of spine.

name: Gorilla Artbook vol. 1 by various Gorilla Artfare artists
description:
A beautiful collection of art from a group of amazing artists, whose work covers a vast array of subjects and styles, from traditional illustrations and paintings in charcoal and oils to cg concept work for video games.

256 pages, Hardcover, 28 x 24.4 x 2.4 cm, English/French

name: Worlds and Wonders by Aleksi Briclot with Marko Djudjevic
description:
Briclot is a fantasy illustrator working in games, comics, book illustration. This lavish coffee table book is full of paintings and color art and has ten fold-out spreads of pencil drawings and process. 

236 Pages, Hardcover, English and French

name: Rome Aquarelles by Fabrice Moireau and Dominique Fernandez
description:
A superb collection of beautiful watercolours from the streets of The Eternal City.

Hardcover, French, 11.3"x9.8"x0.8"

name: Toits de Paris by Fabrice Moreau And Carl Norac
description:
A collection of beautifully intricate, birds eye watercolours of the French Capital.

French, Hardcover, 10.9"x9.3"x0.8"

name: David Colman's Doodles Volume III
description:
The latest sketchbook from David Colman has pencils, watercolors pen and ink and digital works. The subject matter ranges from people to animals to character design from a few movies.

140 Pages, 9.25"x6.25",Hardcover, Signed

name: Zoom Zoo Flash Cards by Mike Yamada
description:
If you have a child, are a child, have been a child at some point in your life, these cards are for you with beautiful artwork from Mike Yamada a great concept artist and designer for animated films such as Kung Fu Panda 2, How To Train Your Dragon and Bee Movie.  There may be some education involved, but who couldn't learn a bit more?

28 cards, 4.5"x7", boxed

name: Back Alleys and Urban Landscapes by Michael Cho
description:
Cho is a skilled draftsman, and Back Alleys and Urban Landscapes shines with lovingly rendered details, from expletive-filled graffiti splayed across backyard fences to the graceful twists of power lines over a bend in the road.

80 pages, softcover

name: Art Hog by Andrew Robinson
description:
Andrew Robinson's latest art book includes finished paintings, illustrations, process, and sketches.

50 pages, 7"x11", Softcover, Signed

name: Some Like It Rough by Matteo Scalera
description:
A beautiful collection of Sketches, Illustrations and Covers in Matteo Scalera's amazing scratchy pen and ink style.

54 pages, 7"x11", Softcover

name: 01 Steampainting Spark by Steambot studios; vyle; barontieri; rainart; feerik and manu
description: An excellent resource for people who need inspiration in their art, and a gentle nudge in the right direction. Full of excellent artwork and instruction.

name: Dolor #3 by Various Artists.
description: The third beautiful little work, from and by a group of artists who wanted to publish their own comics, and story ideas.

name: Dolor #2 by Various Artists.
description:
The second beautiful little work, from and by a group of artists who wanted to publish their own 4 page comics, and story ideas.

Michael Meier – Cover & Illu One
Igor-Alban Chevalier – Deadline
Mcbess – My First Guitar
Cody Tilson – Cody Makes Renovations
Rita Fürstenau – End Papers
Nic Klein – Illu Two & Back Cover

24 Pages, b+w, Saddle Stitched

name: Dolor #1 by Various Artists.
description:
A beautiful little work, from and by a group of artists who wanted to publish their own 4 page comics, and story ideas.

Nic Klein – Covers & Sabbath
Nils Knoblich – Shepherd
Emmanuel Malin – One Last Trip
Sebastian Stamm – The Walt Is Wheezin
Michael Meier – Giants
Lisa Röper – Stag
Johannes Kalden – Forest & Meadows
Rita Fürstenau – End Papers

24 Pages, b+w, Saddle Stitched

name: Art of Edward Pun
description:
A collection of sketches, concept art, graphic design and comic book panels from a superb all rounder in the art field.

48 Pages, Softcover

name: The Art of Thomas N. Perkins IV
description:
"Thomas N. Perkins IV creates odd folks for strange worlds. Since 1997 he's worked tirelessly as a character designer on such film and television projects as 'Extreme Ghostbusters,' 'Big Guy and Rusty the Boy Robot,' 'TMNT,' 'Spectacular Spider-Man,' 'The Batman,' and 'Firebreather.' In 2007 his work on Cartoon Network's 'Ben 10' was awarded the Daytime Emmy for Outstanding Individual Achievement in animation."

60 Pages, Hardcover

name: The Art of Rodolphe Guenoden
description:
A brand new color collection of work by Rodolphe Guenoden, covering a wide range of subjects (superheroes, scenarios, character design) and finishes (sketches, ink brush drawings, cartoons, and colour illustrations).   Maturish audiences only.
64 Pages Hardcover 8"x5.25"

name: Pieces of Meeces by Phil Mendez
description:
The first sketchbook by this veteran animation character designer, storyboarder and creator focuses on mice: hundreds of cartoon mice, in many variations, drawn with charm, appeal and verve.

44 Pages, Comic Bound

name: Paper Sword: The Art of Glenn Kim
description:
A collection of charming colour character sketches and beautiful environments.

38 Pages, Softcover

name: The Pet Project by Beth Sleven
description:
In this follow-up to The Cryptid Case Files, animator Beth Sleven has created a story about a mad scientist who tries to create in his laboratory a pet for his little daughter. Full of creatures, cute, funny, and horrific, wonderfully depicted by Sleven.

48 Pages Softcover 11"x8.5" Signed

name: Varanda Sketchbook #2 by Alberto Varanda
description:
A new foray into the fantasy worlds of Alberto Varanda the Varanda Sketchbook # 2 will allow you to travel in the midst of dragons, warriors, vampires and creatures of all kinds.
Discover a universe teeming with graphic detail, line work of great precision and elegance.
Alberto Varanda also leaves plenty of room for the secrets of his new hero, the adorable Petit Pierrot, and his sketches of nudes and paintings.
48 Pages Softcover 8.75"x7.1" Limited Edition of 900
